020import net.tnemc.core.currency.parser.ParseMoney;
021import net.tnemc.core.currency.parser.ParseRule;
022
023import java.math.BigDecimal;
024import java.util.regex.Matcher;
025import java.util.regex.Pattern;
026
027/**
028 * NumericParseRule
029 *
030 * @author creatorfromhell
031 * @since 0.1.4.0
032 */
033public class NumericParseRule implements ParseRule {
034
035  /**
036   * Retrieves an identifier.
037   *
038   * @return The identifier as a String.
039   */
040  @Override
041  public String identifier() {
042
043    return "numeric";
044  }
045
046  /**
047   * Applies the given parse money object to the input string according to the specified rules.
048   *
049   * @param parseMoney the ParseMoney object to apply the rules to
050   * @param input      the input string to apply the rules on
051   */
052  @Override
053  public String apply(final ParseMoney parseMoney, final String input) {
054
055    final String decimalSeparator = parseMoney.currency().getDecimal();
056    final String majorSeparator = parseMoney.currency().getMajorSeparator();
057
058    String normalizedInput = input;
059
060    if(!decimalSeparator.equals(".")) {
061
062      normalizedInput = normalizedInput.replace(decimalSeparator, "."); // Convert to standard decimal
063    }
064
065    normalizedInput = normalizedInput.replace(majorSeparator, ""); // Remove thousands separator
066
067
068    final Matcher matcher = Pattern.compile("([0-9]+(?:\\.[0-9]*)?(?:[eE][-+]?[0-9]+)?)").matcher(normalizedInput);
069
070    if(matcher.find()) {
071
072      parseMoney.amount(new BigDecimal(matcher.group(1)));
073    }
074    return input;
075  }
076}
